{{ja-kanjitab|じゅう|に|ひとえ}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しゅうにひとえ'|十二|tr1=jūni|t1=twelve|単|tr2=hitoe|t2=unlined or single-layer robe}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|じゅうに ひとえ|acc=5|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|ja|十二一重}}, {{l|ja|十二単衣}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|じゅうに-ひとえ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しゅうにひとえ'|clothing}} a [[ceremonial]] twelve-layered robe worn by women of the [[imperial]] [[court]], consisting of twelve single-layer unlined robes worn one over the other
#: This style became fashionable some time in the tenth century during the {{w|Heian period}}. Starting from the {{w|Muromachi period}}, the term ''jūni-hitoe'' was also used in the popular culture to refer to the five-layer {{m|ja|五重唐衣裳|tr=goe-karaginumo}} style.
# {{lb|ja|sort=しゅうにひとえ'|botany}} {{taxlink|Ajuga nipponensis|species|noshow=1}}, a [[perennial]] plant in the [[mint]] family and native to Japan

====Usage notes====
* {{sense|Ajuga nipponensis}} Members of [[genus]] ''[[Ajuga]]'' are also known as {{m|en|bugleweed}}, ''[[ground pine]]'', ''{{vern|carpet bugle}}'', or just {{m|en|bugle}}. {{U:ja:biology|ジュウニヒトエ}}
